p: We extend the breach modes identified by Grice et al. ( 2010) (Table 1) to capture the relative performance of eradication and containment strategies and summarize the costs of each type of breach in Table 2. We define a new mode: Type 0 – failure to remove an individual before its propagules are dispersed from within the occupied zone. A breach of this type only affects eradication programmes because the occupied zone is not managed by a containment strategy. A Type 0 breach ‘resets the clock’ on eradication in terms of seed bank longevity.
